page.title: 16FARMS NEAR MILVERTON
page.content:
NEAR MILVERTON, THERE IS A FARM CALLED COPHAZE. THEY HAVE TWO HUNDRED ACRES OF LAND, AND ALL FIFTEEN FIELDS ARE OUT TO GRASS. IN BETWEEN THE FIELDS THERE IS A MIXTURE OF HEDGE AND BARBED WIRE. THEY HAVE ABOUT ONE HUNDRED AND THIRTY-FIVE ANIMALS ALTOGETHER INCLUDING SOMETHING LIKE ONE HUNDRED AND THIRTY COWS AND FIVE CHICKENS. THERE IS A LOT OF HARD WORK DONE BY ALL FOUR OF THEIR TRACTORS. THE FARMER PREFERS LIVING IN THE COUNTRY TO LIVING IN THE CITY.
BICKLEY FARM HAS ABOUT ONE HUNDRED ACRES. THEY HAVE ONE HUNDRED COWS AND TWO BULLS. THIS YEAR TWO BABY CALVES HAVE BEEN BORN. THEIR MAIN CROP IS CORN, AND SOME GRASS FOR THE COWS. IN BETWEEN THE FIELDS THERE IS JUST HEDGE. THEY HAVE GOT FOUR TRACTORS AND FOUR TRAILERS TO DO THE WORK.
